'local' is a pseudo-top-level domain used in multicast domain name service
(mDNS) of zero configuration networking discovery protocols.

Apple's Bonjour implements mDNS, as does Avahi. If a computer running Mac OS X
is not assigned a domain name, it identifies itself as hostname.local .

Name resolution issues may arise if multicast DNS software is used in
conjunction with a network that implements the local toplevel
DNS domain.

Despite not being a valid top-level domain in the Internet, considerable DNS
traffic that queries the local domain exists in the public Domain Name
System. {{cite web |url=http://www.circleid.com/posts/20090618_most_popular-
